author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: The best micro holiday homes on Airbnb revealed
text:
219 shares 30
View
comments
With more and more people moving to city centres, space is becoming increasingly limited especially in some of the world's most desirable tourism hot spots.
But Airbnb hosts from Portland to Paris are opening up their compact dwellings to curious urban travellers seeking the chance to experience a stay in a unique micro-home.
Here, accommodation website Airbnb exclusively reveals to MailOnline Travel their top eight micro-homes around the world.
The One Square Meter in Berlin, Germany is the smallest house on the list
One Square Meter in Berlin - £8 per night
The smallest house from the list. Located in Berlin, this property (despite it's name) is 199cm high and only 70cm wide.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next British holidaymaker in intensive care in Ibiza after diving... Is THIS how you'll be spending your bank holiday? A peek... Share this article Share Thankfully for the social-media savvy among us, it still has Wi-Fi so you can share this unique experience online.
Another upside to the property is that pets are allowed, but a top tip is to take your guinea pig with you rather than your the St Bernard.
The house can be either upright or on it's side, as demonstrated by this gentleman
A bed, shelter, and an outside bedside table, what more could you ask for?
Retro micro home in East London - £80 per night
This micro-home is situated in East London, where Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts was born. Complete with a folding bed, this house is evidence that maximum efficiency in terms of space and quality design go well together.
To add to its authentic East London flavour, the house is situated above a listed pie and eel shop.
This house is in a warehouse conversion in East London, above a listed pie and eel shop
The design is sleek and modern, and includes an en-suite toilet and shower
Despite the compact nature of the retro micro-home , the toilet is not such a huge squeeze
Mini-house magazine, Seattle - £67 per night
For those who love industrial design with a homely character, this Seattle micro-home is the perfect place.
The house has been featured in several design books, and the New York Times. The house can accommodate three people in the bed which is accessible via a ladder.
This property is bright and airy, with a ladder leading up to a bed big enough for three
The house has been highlighted for it's effective design and is a New York Times favourite
The Seattle address is custom-designed by an artist and designer, and offers a comfy stay
Micro home in Tokyo - £77 per night
Located in Tokyo, this micro-home is so small that the host has decided to include a fold-up kitchen table.
The property is situated in Shibuya, often considered the hippest part of Tokyo.
Space comes at a premium in the centre of the metropolis, so tourists will be able to experience an true taster of Tokyo life.
The bedroom is overlooked by balcony, the only spot permitted to smoke
The property is decked out in the owner's personal style, and is the perfect location for heading out to Tokyo
The owners hope the design and decoration put the persons staying in a good mood
Self-built and environmentally responsible, Nebraska - £47 per night
Designed by the host himself, this environmentally friendly micro-home is built from wood, with a rough finish.
Highly recommended for anyone thinking of taking a trip to Nebraska, U.S.
A modern tiny house that is all your own. Very comfortable and conveniently located in central Omaha
The owners are available to interact with if you so wish, or you can maintain your privacy
This part of the wall is dominated by the head of a deer, maybe not the last thing you want to see before sleep however
Rustic modern home in Portland - £110 per night
Built entirely from scratch by the hosts from recycled materials, this home is located in Portland, Oregon, U.S. one of the most eco-friendly cities in the world.
There is no better place to explore national parks and special craft beer breweries.
This Portland micro-home looks like it would not look out of place in a chic dolls house
A room of one's owne: Upstairs is the loft bedroom with comfortable queen sized bed
This property was seen on the TV show 'Tiny House Nation,' and was built entirely by the owners and friends
Loft in Paris - £102 per night
In Paris, next to Gare du Nord, you will find this small house at the end of a lane.
The house is fully equipped and even has a small courtyard garden. Ideal for those who want to relax in the bustling metropolis.
Guests will enjoy being seated on the terrace, overlooking the rose, bamboo and orange trees
The property gives guests the feeling of staying in the countryside when in fact they are in bustling Paris
The loft bedroom sleep two people comfortably on a Queen size mattress
70 capsule in Tokyo - £50 per night
This historical and striking Nakagin capsule tower has been around for over 40 years.
With Tokyo house prices skyrocketing, this apartment is an affordable alternative.
The capsule tower gives perfect insight into living life in a few square metres.
Nakagin Capsule Tower is a rare built example of Japanese Metabolism, a movement that became emblematic of Japan's postwar cultural resurgence
Located in Ginza, which is center of Tokyo. Nearest Metro station is Ginza, Higashi Ginza, or Shimbashi
Back to the future: The property's ambience and finish still looks futuristic
